Description: Pottery jar with a rounded base(damaged), convex sides, a small shoulder, a concave neck narrowing to the inverted rim(chipped), two handles and decorated with a dark slip, rows of applied red and white nodules and an applied frieze of red and white running relief vegetation(damaged).
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1997 / Handbook of Mediterranean Roman pottery (pl.IV)
Condition: fair - damage to base, rim and main frieze
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
